meanings.definition: To remove equipment or supplies from someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will unequip the toolbox before we leave.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to unequip the camera before returning it.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to unequip the rabbit from his hat, but it refused to budge.
meanings.sent4: She unequipped her worries and set off on a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The knight had to unequip his heavy armor to move swiftly in battle.

meanings.definition: To be without necessary equipment or supplies.
meanings.sent1: Without a map, we were unequipped for the journey ahead.
meanings.sent2: The hiker found himself unequipped for the sudden storm.
meanings.sent3: The chef felt unequipped when he realized he had forgotten the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: She felt unequipped to handle the challenges that lay ahead.
meanings.sent5: The team was unequipped but determined to succeed against all odds.
